verbs.description: ghostwrite (third-person singular simple present ghostwrites, present participle ghostwriting, simple past ghostwrote, past participle ghostwritten)

entries.meaning: (authorship, intransitive) To write under the name of another (especially literary works).
examples: Mariana would rather not ghostwrite for a living because she finds it a thankless task.

entries.meaning: (authorship, transitive) To author a literary work or speech in the place of another.
examples: The president has someone to ghostwrite his addresses.
